title: Police: $150,000 worth of stolen retail recovered at couple's...
text:
Seattle Police detectives arrested a 63-year-old man and his 58-year-old wife Friday after finding 1, 590 stolen items at their house.
Officers recovered 400 pairs of jeans, perfume, toiletries, purses and shoes that they believe were purchased for pennies on the dollar from downtown shoplifters.
>> Read more trending stories
Police found additional stolen items in a storage locker that belonged to the couple, including seven boxes full of stolen jeans. Most of the items came from department stores and individual shops in downtown’s retail core.
Seattle police estimate that the combined retail value of the items is around $150,000.
Operation: Crosstown Traffic continues as detectives recover 400 pairs of stolen jeans http://t.co/dS35ekA1fq pic.twitter.com/hA6aymug31
— Seattle Police Dept. (@SeattlePD) October 16, 2015
